docs.lead_paragraph: A new study provides the strongest evidence yet of a link between elevated blood-lead levels in children living in Flint, Michigan, and the struggling city's water system, a pediatrician who first raised alarms about the matter said Monday.

headline.main: Doctor: Strongest Link Yet Between Water, Kids' Lead Levels
headline.print_headline: Doctor: Strongest Link Yet Between Water, Kids' Lead Levels

docs.snippet: A new study provides the strongest evidence yet of a link between elevated blood-lead levels in children living in Flint, Michigan, and the struggling city's water system, a pediatrician who first raised alarms about the matter said Monday.

docs.lead_paragraph: Robert Bobroczkyi, a 15-year-old Romanian who plays for the Stellazzurra Basketball Academy in Rome, stands 7 feet 6 inches and has caught the eye of youth league scouts in Europe.

docs.lead_paragraph: Spain's Mireia Lalaguna Royo was named the winner of the Miss World 2015 competition in the southern Chinese island resort of Sanya, an event dogged by controversy over China's refusal to allow Canada's entrant to attend.

docs.lead_paragraph: At 7-foot-6 (2.29 meters), 15-year-old Robert Bobroczkyi is already taller than New York Knicks sensation Kristaps Porzingis — or any other current NBA player.

docs.lead_paragraph: American Alan Gross spent five years in a Cuban prison before being released last year as part of a historic reopening of relations between the United States and Cuba, but he says he'd travel back to the island nation "in a heartbeat, as long as the government promises not to re-arrest me."

headline.main: American Marks 1 Year Since Being Freed From Cuban Prison
headline.print_headline: American Marks 1 Year Since Being Freed From Cuban Prison

docs.lead_paragraph: Award-winning chef Justin Aprahamian and his staff decided that a hearty French cassoulet — a stew with meat and vegetables — was a good dish for his regulars on a December night.

docs.lead_paragraph: The proposed merger and three-way breakup of Dow Chemical and DuPont are impressive feats of financial engineering with doubtful benefits.

headline.main: Remaking Dow and DuPont for the Activist Shareholders
headline.print_headline: Does a Deal Have the Right Chemistry, or Is It Just Financial Engineering?

docs.abstract: Steven Davidoff Solomon Deal Professor column examines proposed merger of Dow Chemical and DuPont, noting it is impressive work of financial engineering; says plan to split it into three new companies is no easy feat, and creating value for shareholders could be problematical.
docs.snippet: The proposed merger and three-way breakup of Dow Chemical and DuPont are impressive feats of financial engineering with doubtful benefits.

docs.lead_paragraph: Congress should stop a backdoor effort to insert language in the omnibus spending bill that would bar states from passing G.M.O. labeling laws.
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by Tom Colicchio criticizes lawmakers who are trying to include measure in budget legislation that will block states from mandating GMO disclosure on food packaging; urges Congress to block measures and to leave decision of whether to eat and buy GMO foods up to informed consumers.
docs.snippet: Congress should stop a backdoor effort to insert language in the omnibus spending bill that would bar states from passing G.M.O. labeling laws.
